page.title: 11Mortimer Railway Station
page.content: The station was designed by Brunel, who personally supervised the building of the broad-guage line. It served the Duke of Wellington's Estate; he was on the platform, and so was the population of Mortimer, to wave when Queen Victoria rode through in 1870. Although the focus of the village is now at the top of the hill, the rail- way still plays a vital part in Mortimer life. The Ticket Office is manned part-time by a long serving station-mistress! Passenger movements have grown from 28,000 in 1980 to 43,000 in 1983. The car park has been extended to accommodate commuters' cars (70 cars were counted in 1984 compared to 15 in 1974).The station has been renovated in this 150th anniversary of the G.W.R. It has a new roof with tiles replacing the slates, as in the original building.
